an10.74:1.1: “Mendicants, a noble disciple who grows in ten ways grows nobly, taking on what is essential and excellent in this life.
an10.74:1.3: He grows in fields and lands, money and grain, wives and children, in bondservants, workers, and staff, and in livestock. And he grows in faith, ethics, learning, generosity, and wisdom.
an10.74:1.4: A noble disciple who grows in ten ways grows nobly, taking on what is essential and excellent in this life.
an10.74:2.1: Someone who grows in money and grain,
an10.74:2.4: by relatives and friends, and even by royals.
an10.74:3.1: When someone grows in faith and ethics,
an10.74:3.2: wisdom, and both generosity and learning—
an10.74:3.3: a good man such as he sees clearly,
an10.74:3.4: and in the present life he grows in both ways.”
